name: FastQC
description: A quality control tool for high throughput sequence data.

name: BLAST
description: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool for comparing nucleotide or protein sequences.

name: HISAT2
description: A fast and sensitive alignment program for mapping RNA-seq reads.

name: Cytoscape
description: An open-source platform for complex network analysis and visualization.

name: FlowJo
description: A software application with an integrated environment for viewing and analyzing flow cytometric data.

name: ImageJ
description: An open-source image processing program designed for scientific multidimensional images.

name: MATLAB
description: A programming and numeric computing platform used by engineers and scientists.

name: GraphPad Prism
description: A software program combining scientific graphing, comprehensive curve fitting, and data organization.

name: RStudio
description: An integrated development environment for R, a programming language for statistical computing and graphics.

name: GSEA
description: A computational method that determines whether an a priori defined set of genes shows statistically significant differences.

name: Galaxy
description: An open, web-based platform for accessible, reproducible, and transparent computational biomedical research.

name: CellProfiler
description: An open-source software for measuring and analyzing cell images.

name: SPSS
description: A powerful statistical software platform used for advanced statistical analysis.

name: MaxQuant
description: A quantitative proteomics software package designed for analyzing large mass spectrometric data.

name: OpenMS
description: An open-source software C++ library for LC-MS data management and analyses.

name: Qlucore Omics Explorer
description: Software for advanced data analysis and visualization in life science research.

name: QIIME 2
description: A next-generation microbiome bioinformatics platform that is extensible, free, and open source.

name: SRA Toolkit
description: A collection of tools and libraries for retrieving and formatting DNA sequence data.

name: Seurat
description: An R toolkit for single-cell genomics, designed to explore cellular heterogeneity.

name: TissueGnostics
description: Provides solutions for automated tissue image analysis.

name: AutoDock
description: A suite of automated docking tools designed to predict how small molecules bind to a receptor of known 3D structure.

name: PyMOL
description: A molecular visualization system with an open-source foundation, producing high-quality 3D images.

name: DeepLabCut
description: An open-source toolbox for markerless pose estimation of animals using deep learning.

name: Igor Pro
description: A software environment for experimentation with scientific and engineering data.

name: Bioconductor
description: An open-source project providing tools for the analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data.

name: Bowtie
description: An ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

name: Cufflinks
description: A program for transcriptome assembly and differential expression analysis of RNA-Seq data.

name: DESeq2
description: An R package to analyze count data from RNA-Seq experiments and test for differential expression.

name: IGV (Integrative Genomics Viewer)
description: A high-performance visualization tool for interactive exploration of large, integrated genomic datasets.

name: MAFFT
description: A multiple sequence alignment program for amino acid or nucleotide sequences.

name: MEGA
description: Molecular Evolutionary Genetics Analysis software for comparative analysis of homologous sequences.

name: Mothur
description: An open-source software package that enables processing of 16S rRNA gene sequences.

name: NanoPlot
description: A plotting tool for Oxford Nanopore sequencing data and associated QC files.

name: PLINK
description: A whole-genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner.

name: Proteome Discoverer
description: A comprehensive software suite for analyzing qualitative and quantitative proteomics data.

name: PyTorch
description: An open-source machine learning library based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing.

name: QIAGEN CLC Genomics Workbench
description: A software suite for analyzing, visualizing, and interpreting omics data.

name: Samtools
description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data, providing various utilities for manipulating alignments in the SAM format.

name: Scikit-learn
description: A Python module for machine learning built on SciPy, providing simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis.

name: StringTie
description: A fast and highly efficient assembler of RNA-Seq alignments into potential transcripts.

name: TopHat
description: A fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads that aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes.

name: Trimmomatic
description: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data to remove adapters and low-quality bases.

name: VELVET
description: A set of algorithms optimized for short read sequencing data to assemble genomes.

name: WaveSurfer
description: A MATLAB software package for electrophysiological data acquisition and analysis.

name: WebGestalt
description: A functional enrichment analysis web tool, providing a way to identify biological functions related to a given gene list.

name: WEKA
description: A collection of machine learning algorithms for data mining tasks, featuring tools for data pre-processing, classification, regression, clustering, and more.

name: XCMS
description: A software platform for the analysis of LC/MS data including raw data processing and feature detection.

name: Zenodo
description: An open-access repository that enables researchers to share and preserve research outputs in any size, any format, and from any field of science.

name: Zotero
description: A free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share research.

name: BioGRID
description: A curated database of protein and genetic interactions.

name: Bowtie 2
description: An ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

name: BWA
description: A software package for mapping low-divergent sequences against a large reference genome.

name: CLUMPP
description: A program that helps identify the optimal alignment of multiple population structure analyses.

name: Circos
description: A software package for visualizing data and information in a circular layout.

name: COBRA Toolbox
description: A MATLAB toolbox for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of genome-scale metabolic models.

name: CONCOCT
description: A program for unsupervised binning of metagenomic contigs by clustering nucleotide composition and coverage.

name: CONSEL
description: A program for assessing the confidence of phylogenetic tree selection.

name: CUT&RUNTools
description: A pipeline for analyzing CUT&RUN sequencing data for profiling chromatin.

name: DEAP
description: A novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of ideas.

name: DIAMOND
description: An ultra-fast protein alignment tool for large-scale metagenomic protein searches.

name: DOGMA
description: A web-based program for annotating mitochondrial and chloroplast genome sequences.

name: Edgar
description: A platform for the comparative analysis of genomes with a focus on ortholog identification.

name: EDGE Bioinformatics
description: An open-source, user-friendly bioinformatics platform for various genomics and metagenomics analyses.

name: EIGENSOFT
description: A suite of programs for population genetics analyses using principal component analysis.

name: EMBOSS
description: A bioinformatics software package for the analysis of sequence data.

name: ENCoRE
description: A computational tool for analyzing enhancer RNAs using ChIP-Seq data.

name: EPIC
description: An algorithm for analyzing ChIP-seq data to identify regions of transcription factor binding.

name: Escher
description: A web-based visualization tool for genome-scale metabolic maps.

name: FASTX-Toolkit
description: A collection of command line tools for preprocessing short read sequences in FASTA/FASTQ format.

name: FELLA
description: An R package for enriched pathway analysis in metabolomics.

name: Fiji
description: A distribution of ImageJ focused on biological image analysis.

name: FLUXCAPACITOR
description: A software for quantifying the abundance of alternatively spliced isoforms in RNA-Seq data.

name: GATK (Genome Analysis Toolkit)
description: A toolkit for variant discovery in high-throughput sequencing data.

name: GeneMANIA
description: A web-based tool for predicting the function of genes and gene sets using functional interaction networks.

name: Geneious
description: A software platform for the organization and analysis of molecular biology data.

name: GEMMA
description: A software tool for genome-wide association analysis using a linear mixed model.

name: GEO2R
description: An online tool for comparing groups of samples in a GEO Series to identify differentially expressed genes.

name: GROMACS
description: A versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e., simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles.

name: GSEApy
description: A Python package for gene set enrichment analysis.

name: HTSeq
description: A Python package for processing and analyzing high-throughput sequencing data.

name: Infernal
description: A software package for RNA homology search and alignment using covariance models.

name: I-TASSER
description: A software suite for automated protein structure and function prediction.

name: Jalview
description: A free program for multiple sequence alignment editing, visualization, and analysis.

name: Kaiju
description: A program for taxonomic classification of high-throughput metagenomic sequencing reads.

name: KBase
description: An open-source software and data science platform designed for collaborative, systems biology research.

name: Kraken
description: An ultrafast and highly accurate program for assigning taxonomic labels to metagenomic DNA sequences.

name: Liftover
description: A tool for converting coordinates between different genome assemblies.

name: MAnorm
description: A normalization and comparison tool for ChIP-seq datasets.

name: MAUVE
description: A software tool for the alignment of conserved genomic sequences and the discovery of rearrangements.

name: MISO
description: A probabilistic framework for RNA-Seq analysis and quantification of alternative splicing events.

name: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE)
description: A comprehensive suite of tools for molecular modeling, simulation, and drug discovery.

name: MultiQC
description: A tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many samples into a single report.

name: NanoMod
description: A computational tool for identifying DNA modifications in nanopore sequencing data.

name: ncRNA-Predict
description: A tool for predicting non-coding RNA genes in genomic sequences.

name: ngs.plot
description: A tool for visualizing the enrichment of high-throughput sequencing signals.

name: Nextstrain
description: An open-source project to harness the scientific and public health potential of pathogen genome data.

name: OncoPrint
description: A tool for visualizing multiple genomic alterations in cancer research.

name: Partek Flow
description: A genomics analysis software designed to analyze next-generation sequencing data.

name: Picard
description: A set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats.

name: Plink2
description: A toolset for whole-genome association and population-based linkage analyses.

name: Prokka
description: A software tool for the rapid annotation of prokaryotic genomes.

name: PyRx
description: A Virtual Screening software for Computational Drug Discovery that can be used to screen libraries of compounds against potential drug targets.

name: Raven
description: A MATLAB toolbox for generating genome-scale metabolic models.

name: RSEM
description: An RNA-Seq transcript quantification software that estimates gene and isoform expression levels.

name: SAMtools
description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data.

name: SANSparallel
description: A software package for detecting protein domains and comparing their sequences.

name: Shiny
description: An R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R.

name: SIFT
description: A program that predicts whether an amino acid substitution affects protein function.

name: SimBioNeT
description: A versatile bioinformatics pipeline for the analysis of microbiome and metagenomics data.

name: SPAdes
description: A genome assembler for single-cell and multi-cell bacterial datasets.

name: STRING
description: A database of known and predicted protein-protein interactions.

name: T-COFFEE
description: A software package for computing, evaluating, and manipulating multiple alignments of DNA, RNA, protein sequences, and structures.

name: Taverna
description: An open-source suite of tools for designing and executing scientific workflows.

name: TreeView
description: A program that provides a way to visualize hierarchical clustering results.

name: Trinity
description: A software package for de novo transcriptome assembly from RNA-Seq data.

name: UCSC Genome Browser
description: An online platform for viewing the human genome and other genomes.

name: VCFtools
description: A program package designed for working with VCF files, a format for storing genetic variation data.

name: VEGA
description: A comprehensive suite of molecular modeling tools for the analysis of chemical and biological data.

name: VMD
description: A tool for displaying, animating, and analyzing large biomolecular systems using 3D graphics and built-in scripting.

name: WHAM
description: A software tool for calling structural variants in whole-genome sequencing data.

name: X! Tandem
description: A program that matches tandem mass spectrometry data with protein sequences.

name: ZEN Intensity Analysis
description: A software tool for analyzing fluorescence intensity in microscopic images.

name: ZetaHunter
description: A tool for identifying the fungal species present in high-throughput metagenomic data.

name: Scanpy
description: A scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data.

name: Cell Ranger
description: A set of analysis pipelines for processing 10x Genomics single-cell gene expression data.

name: Monocle
description: An R toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data to reconstruct cell trajectories.

name: TensorFlow
description: An open-source machine learning framework developed by Google for numerical computation and large-scale machine learning.

name: Keras
description: An open-source software library that provides a Python interface for artificial neural networks. Keras acts as an interface for the TensorFlow library.

name: NumPy
description: A fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.

name: SciPy
description: An open-source Python library used for scientific and technical computing.

name: Pandas
description: An open-source data analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming language.

name: Scikit-image
description: An open-source image processing library for Python.

name: OpenCV
description: An open-source computer vision and machine learning software library.

name: KNIME
description: An open-source analytics platform for creating data science applications and services.

name: Kallisto
description: An alignment-free method for quantifying abundances of transcripts from RNA-Seq data.

name: Salmon
description: A tool for quantifying transcript abundances from RNA-Seq data with lightweight algorithms.

name: edgeR
description: An R package for differential expression analysis of digital gene expression data.

name: STAR
description: An ultrafast universal RNA-Seq aligner.

name: Minimap2
description: A versatile sequence alignment program that aligns DNA or mRNA sequences against a large reference database.

name: SnpEff
description: A genetic variant annotation and effect prediction toolbox.

name: BEDTools
description: A powerful toolset for genome arithmetic, allowing manipulation of genomic features in BED, GFF/GTF, VCF formats.

name: MACS2
description: Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq data to identify transcription factor binding sites.

name: HMMER
description: A software suite for sequence analysis using profile hidden Markov models.

name: Clustal Omega
description: A fast and scalable tool for multiple sequence alignment of protein sequences.

name: OrthoFinder
description: An accurate and fast orthology inference tool.

name: BUSCO
description: Benchmarking Universal Single-Copy Orthologs: assessing genome assembly and annotation completeness.

name: SnpSift
description: A toolbox that allows filtering and manipulation of annotated SNPs in VCF format.

name: Artemis
description: A genome browser and annotation tool that allows visualization of sequence features.

name: BEDOPS
description: A fast, highly scalable, and easily-parallelizable genome analysis toolkit.

name: BCFtools
description: Tools for manipulating VCF and BCF files, such as calling and filtering variants.

name: Biopython
description: A set of freely available tools for biological computation written in Python.

name: BioPerl
description: A collection of Perl modules that facilitate the development of Perl scripts for bioinformatics applications.

name: UCSF Chimera
description: An extensible molecular modeling system for interactive visualization and analysis.

name: UCSF ChimeraX
description: The next-generation molecular visualization program from the UCSF Chimera team.

name: GCTA
description: Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis tool for estimating the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by all SNPs.

name: MRtrix3
description: A software package for the processing and visualization of diffusion MRI data.

name: FreeSurfer
description: A software package for the analysis and visualization of structural and functional neuroimaging data.

name: FSL
description: FMRIB Software Library: a comprehensive library of analysis tools for FMRI, MRI and DTI brain imaging data.

name: SPM
description: Statistical Parametric Mapping: a software package designed for the analysis of brain imaging data sequences.

name: ANTs
description: Advanced Normalization Tools: a software suite for processing and analysis of multidimensional images.

name: Canu
description: A genome assembler for high-noise single-molecule sequencing reads.

name: Flye
description: A de novo assembler for single molecule sequencing reads, such as those produced by PacBio and Oxford Nanopore Technologies.

name: QUAST
description: Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies.

name: SSPACE
description: A scaffolding tool for assembling draft genomes using paired-read data.

name: SOAPdenovo2
description: A short-read assembly method that can build a de novo draft assembly for large genomes.

name: MrBayes
description: A program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models.

name: RAxML
description: Randomized Axelerated Maximum Likelihood: a program for sequential and parallel Maximum Likelihood-based inference of large phylogenetic trees.

name: IQ-TREE
description: An efficient software for phylogenomic inference using maximum likelihood.

name: OrthoMCL
description: An algorithm for grouping orthologous protein sequences across multiple genomes.

name: ETE Toolkit
description: Environment for Tree Exploration: a Python programming toolkit for tree visualization and analysis.

name: PHYLIP
description: The PHYLogeny Inference Package: a free package of programs for inferring phylogenies.

name: HyPhy
description: Hypothesis testing using phylogenies: an open-source software package for the analysis of genetic sequences using techniques in molecular evolution.

name: Gblocks
description: A program that eliminates poorly aligned positions and divergent regions of an alignment.

name: BEAST
description: Bayesian Evolutionary Analysis Sampling Trees: a software package for Bayesian analysis of molecular sequences using MCMC.

name: NAMD
description: A parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems.

name: LAMMPS
description: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator: a classical molecular dynamics code.

name: Molden
description: A pre- and post-processing program of molecular and electronic structure.

name: Open Babel
description: An open-source chemical toolbox designed to speak the many languages of chemical data.

name: Bioconda
description: A channel for the conda package manager specializing in bioinformatics software.

name: Miniconda
description: A minimal installer for conda, a package manager and environment management system.

name: Snakemake
description: A workflow management system to create reproducible and scalable data analyses.

name: Nextflow
description: A data-driven workflow framework that enables scalable and reproducible scientific workflows.

name: Common Workflow Language (CWL)
description: A specification for describing analysis workflows and tools in a way that makes them portable and scalable.

name: Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP)
description: A tool for annotating and predicting the effects of genetic variants.

name: Reactome
description: An open-source, curated, and peer-reviewed pathway database.

name: DAVID
description: Database for Annotation, Visualization, and Integrated Discovery: a web tool for functional annotation of genes and proteins.

name: KEGG
description: Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes: a resource for understanding high-level functions of biological systems.

name: DeepVariant
description: An analysis pipeline that uses a deep neural network to call genetic variants from next-generation DNA sequencing data.

name: VarScan
description: A platform-independent tool for variant detection in massively parallel sequencing data.

name: FreeBayes
description: A Bayesian genetic variant detector designed to find small polymorphisms.

name: Gnuplot
description: A portable command-line driven graphing utility.

name: SAS
description: A software suite developed for advanced analytics, multivariate analyses, business intelligence, data management, and predictive analytics.

name: Mplus
description: A statistical modeling program that provides researchers with a flexible tool to analyze their data.

name: GNU Octave
description: A high-level programming language, primarily intended for numerical computations.

name: Keras
description: An open-source neural-network library written in Python, capable of running on top of TensorFlow.

name: TensorFlow
description: An end-to-end open-source platform for machine learning developed by Google.

name: Apache Spark
description: An open-source distributed general-purpose cluster-computing framework.

name: Apache Hadoop
description: An open-source framework that allows for the distributed processing of large data sets across clusters of computers.

name: KNIME
description: An open-source data analytics, reporting, and integration platform.

name: Orange
description: An open-source data visualization, machine learning and data mining toolkit.

name: RapidMiner
description: A data science platform for teams that unites data prep, machine learning, and predictive model deployment.

name: Jupyter Notebook
description: An open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text.

name: Anaconda
description: A distribution of the Python and R programming languages for scientific computing.

name: Docker
description: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers.

name: Singularity
description: A container platform that leverages HPC resources for reproducible science.

name: Git
description: A distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects.

name: GitHub
description: A web-based hosting service for version control using Git.

name: R
description: A programming language and free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

name: Python
description: A high-level, interpreted programming language with dynamic semantics.

name: Julia
description: A high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for numerical computing.

name: Stata
description: An integrated statistical software package that provides data analysis, data management, and graphics.

name: Minitab
description: A statistics package developed for data analysis.
